subject: Qualification criteria in case of Harmonious Substitutions of existing Concessionaires or selected bidders/consortiums by Fund Houses
text: HRay <754 XTTHTf nifearrut THI / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 4 (sc Warv a_{TTHTf HTT4) Sa Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) af-5 V 6, 4azr-10, &Ra, # ferit-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/Modification in the Harmonious Substitution No. 8.4.19/2020 dated 24" February, 2020 (Decision taken on Agenda Item no. 145.13 in 145th Authority's Meeting held o 27.12.2019) Subject: Qualification Criteria in case of Harmonious Substitutions of existing Concessionaires or selected pidders/ consortiums by Fund Houses. The qualification criteria at Para-4(iii) of Policy Circular no_ NHAI/11033/CGM (FA)/4/2014 dated 29.01.2014 (copy enclosed) in case of Harmonious Substitutions by Fund Houses is modified as under: Stage of Project Qualification Criteria For projects that Technical Criteria have achieved COD (a) To be considered as qualified Bidder, the either itself or along with its O&M Contractor, shall have expended a minimum of <O&M Cost for a block of 5 years> and; (b) Shall have, itself or with O&M Contractor handled for a minimum period of 2 (two) years at least 2 (two) road projects, each of which is at least 50% length of the highway. (ii) Financial Criteria: The bidder should have Assets Under Management /Committed funds available for deployment" Sx of the TPC of the Project. (Assets under Management shall also include the assets of the associate of the bidder?. ) For projects under Technical Criteria construction (a) Tn be considered as qualified Bidder, the entity either itself or along with its Construction Contractor, shall have expended a minimum of 100% of  remaining cost of the project as assessed by Independent Engineer on Category 1 and 3 projects as per the Model RFQ (MoRTH/June 2009) for BOT(Toll) projects; or; (b) To be considered as qualified Bidder, the entity either itself or through its Construction Contractor, shall have expended a minimum of Twice of the remaining cost of the project as assessed by Independent Engineer on Category 2 and 4 projects as per the Model RFQ (MoRTH/ June 2009) for BOT(Toll) projects.
